text.__SUMMARY__: Emin Pasha's worm snake (Leptotyphlops emini) is a species of snake in the family Leptotyphlopidae. The species is endemic to northern East Africa.
text.Etymology: The specific name, emini, is in honor of German-born physician Eduard Schnitzer, who worked in the Ottoman Empire and became known as Emin Pasha.
text.Geographic range: L. emini is found in Democratic Republic of Congo (formerly Zaire), Kenya, Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda, and Zambia.
text.Description: L. emini is uniformly blackish in color.  It has 14 rows of scales around the body.  Adults may attain a total length (including tail) of 11 cm (4.3 in).
text.Further reading: Boulenger GA (1890). "Description of a new Snake of the Genus Glauconia, Gray, obtained by Dr. Emin Pasha on the Victoria Nyanza". Ann. Mag. Nat. Hist., Sixth Series 6: 91-93. (Glauconia emini, new species, p. 91).
